sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"偏见，成见"之意。
means: prejudice ： 侧重指在缺乏理由或证据之前就形成怀疑的、有恶感的偏见。
bias ： 指因个人的好恶或偏见，对人或物作出的不正确、或好或坏的判断或意见。

sentence.Network_en: Rowe does a very clever riff on the nature of prejudice.
sentence.Network_cn: 罗就偏见的本质讲了一番很精辟的话。

sentence.Network_en: I've spent a lifetime fighting against racism and prejudice.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一辈子都在同种族主义和偏见作斗争。

sentence.Network_en: I'm calling in reference to your series on prejudice.
sentence.Network_cn: 我打电话是要谈谈你写的有关“偏见”的系列文章。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Law)extinguishing any right to pursue a claim in another suit
(Law)without detriment to any existing right or claim

lj.lj_ly: the payment was made &B{without} any &B{prejudice to} her rights.
lj.lj_ls: 这笔款的支付对她的权利没有任何损害。

means.word_mean: 偏见,成见;预先形成的概念;事先决定

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in sense 2 of the noun): from Old French, from Latin praejudicium, from prae 'in advance' + judicium 'judgement'

entry.def: Prejudice is an unreasonable dislike of a particular group of people or things, or a preference for one group of people or things over another.

example.ex: There was a deep-rooted racial prejudice long before the two countries became rivals and went to war...
example.tran: 早在这两个国家成为敌人并且兵戎相见之前，它们之间就有了根深蒂固的种族偏见。

example.ex: There is widespread prejudice against workers over 45...
example.tran: 人们普遍对年龄超过45岁的工人存有偏见。

entry.tran: 使有成见；使有偏见；使出现偏袒
entry.def: If you prejudice someone or something, you influence them so that they are unfair in some way.

example.ex: I think your South American youth has prejudiced you...
example.tran: 我认为你在南美度过的青少年时代让你产生了偏见。

example.ex: The report was held back for fear of prejudicing his trial...
example.tran: 因为担心会使他的审判有失公正，这篇报道被暂时压了下来。

entry.def: If someone prejudices another person's situation, they do something which makes it worse than it should be.

example.ex: Her study was not in any way intended to prejudice the future development of the college...
example.tran: 她的研究绝对无意损害这所大学未来的发展。

example.ex: They claim the council has prejudiced their health by failing to deal with asbestos.
example.tran: 他们声称，理事会没有处理好石棉的问题，从而损害了他们的健康。

entry.tran: 无损于；没有对…造成不利；没有对…带来改变
entry.def: If you take an action without prejudice to an existing situation, your action does not change or harm that situation.

example.ex: We accept the outcome of the inquiry, without prejudice to the unsettled question of territorial waters.
example.tran: 我们接受了调查结果，并没有使悬而未决的领海问题进一步恶化。

means.word_mean: 1. a partiality that prevents objective consideration of an issue or situation

auth_sentence.content: A temporary concession did not prejudice their ultimate goal.
auth_sentence.res_content: A temporary concession did not prejudice their ultimate goal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A temporary concession did not prejudice their ultimate goal.

auth_sentence.content: Pride and Prejudice was published two hundred years ago.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pride and Prejudice was published two hundred years ago.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pride and Prejudice was published two hundred years ago.

auth_sentence.content: Therefore, human prejudice is an evolutionarily conserved trait.
auth_sentence.res_content: Therefore, human prejudice is an evolutionarily conserved trait.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Therefore, human prejudice is an evolutionarily conserved trait.

stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+judicious[adj.有判断力的,明智的]→adj.不明智的;不慎重的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 司法的,法庭的,审判的;明断的,公正的
stems_affixes.word_buile: judic判断,审理,法官+ial……的→adj.司法的,法庭的,审判的;明断的,公正的
judic判断,审理,法官+iary=ary……的→adj.司法的, 法院的
judic判断,审理,法官+ious……的→adj.有判断力的,明智的
pre预先+judic判断,审理,法官+e→预先判断→有偏见
ad一再+judic判断,审理,法官+ate表动词→一再判断→裁判
pre预先+judic判断,审理,法官+e→预先判断→有偏见

Sentence.sentence: Recent reports found that lodging with a student of a different race may decrease prejudice and compel students to engage in more ethnically diverse friendships.
Students of different races are prejudiced against each other.
The jury's prejudice against his race.
Obama's election has eliminated the prejudice against blacks

means.word_mean: 成见, 偏见, 歧视

sentences.en: They accused him of having a prejudice against his women employees.
sentences.cn: 他们指责他歧视女雇员。

sentences.en: His voice and manner prejudice his audience against him.
sentences.cn: 他的声音和举止都使听众反感。

sentences.en: Your bad spelling may prejudice your chances of getting this job.
sentences.cn: 你糟糕的拼写会妨碍你获得这个工作的机会。

jushi.english: A judge must be free from prejudice.
They accused him of having a prejudice against his women employees.
jushi.chinese: 他们指责他歧视女雇员。

jushi.english: His voice and manner prejudice his audience against him.
jushi.chinese: 他的声音和风度都使听众反感。
